original_title: Sri Lanka legislator warns thief running loose in central bank
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka should make efforts to catch the individual(s) who had apparently stolen a big bundle of notes from the central bank’s currency issue office, opposition legislator Niroshan Perera told parliament.
Opposition MP Perera of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya had asked for an update on the currency note theft from the finance minister.

“You mentioned that there are two investigations ongoing into the theft of a Rs 50 lakh bundle of money from the central bank. So you haven’t caught the thief yet; that means there is a thief in the central bank.”

State Minister for Finance Shehan Semasinghe said investigations are continuing into the incident: “There are two investigations ongoing; an internal investigation and one by the Criminal Investigation Department of the Police. Only when they are concluded can we ascertain what happened, who the culprit is.”
“The governor himself has asked that the investigations be expedited. Once everything is concluded we will inform this assembly of the details.”
Niroshan Perera said, “So you have been unable after so long to catch the thief in the central bank. We ask howcome with the CCTV and all the security measures this is not possible?”
Semasinghe said more information could be provided at a later date, since it was not in the original list of questions for the minister. (Colombo/Nov28/2023)
